SentimentText: Tuba is super laid back, charming and warm. Order anything over here and you won't regret! My personal favorites here are Lamb Chops for entree and Kunefe for dessert with Turkish tea. Lamb chops are tender and flavorful. Kenefe (cheese dessert that comes topped with vanilla icecream) is cold and warm, crunchy and soft, creamy and sweet... basically one of the best desserts you still ever have!Make sure you get a reservation since this place is always busy!

SentimentText: What a fantastic find! Me and fiancé love Istanbul as it was the first country we travelled to together and because of how much we love Turkish food! We'd been missing it recently and stumbled upon this absolute gem. If you are looking for authentic Mediterranean food in the Bay Area at a reasonable price, this is your place! Tuba is tucked away on a quiet street corner in the Mission District and possesses a fantastic staff that demonstrates extreme attention to detail and is generous with their bread! The hummus is fresh and tasted fantastic next to the bread. The Kuzu Sis was perfectly cooked and the Musakka was extremely wholesome. Overall, a fantastic restaurant with great food and great service. Well worth the visit!
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Super solid dinner spot, but man is this place tiny! Our large group was packed in with a ton of other large groups. The place was pretty loud and you definitely felt like you had to head out and get a breath of fresh air once you were done eating. I will say the service was pretty solid for how packed the place was and the menu had a ton of tasty options.Not surprising the appetizer menu here is hard to narrow down. So much deliciousness! While the grape leaves weren't my favorite I did enjoy many of the other dishes the table ordered like the hummus and falafel. Our table was pretty split in ordering the lamb or the salmon. I opted for the salmon and was super happy with my choice. The fish was cooked and seasoned perfectly. The creamed spinach that came along with it-- I could just eat a quart of it easily. It was really delicious. Overall a great place for dinner, but maybe not so much for a large group.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: I was so excited to try a new (to me) restaurant that was so highly rated while in San Francisco with my team last week! Tuba did not disappoint. My friend and I were the first to arrive, and we were deciding between the two rosés on the menu, when our server offered us a taste of each - very nice! We opted for the drier of the two, which was served in chilled glasses which I thought was an awesome touch. Nothing better than a super cold glass of rosé, in my opinion. When the rest of our group arrived, we ordered a selection of appetizers. Hummus, falafel, and a baked shrimp and feta dish were just some of the dishes among many we shared. This was a great start to the meal and everything I tasted was delicious.The chicken dish I had my eye on wasn't available that night, so I opted for the baked salmon with creamed spinach. My other thought was to go for the off-menu dumplings in Greek yogurt sauce, but I will have to try those next time. The salmon proved to be a great choice - a nice mix of healthy and rich/savory on one plate. Everyone was stuffed after their meals and we skipped dessert. It's worth noting that service was excellent and the staff worked together so you could make eye contact with any of the servers and they would be right over to help (usually just for another glass of wine since they were so on top of everything else, including water refills). I would happily return for another meal.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: The wait was worth it. The restaurant has a nice homey feel, coincidentally 2 birthday serenades took place tonight that made the place feel warm and welcoming! We ordered three entrees: Sarma beyti kebab (beef wrapped in bread with tomato and yogurt garlic sauce), karniyarik (eggplant with ground beef), and the manti (hidden menu item of beef dumplings and yogurt garlic sauce).The manti was delicious, handmade garlic and beef dumplings with enough sauce to dip our complimentary fresh baked bread.  The sarma beyti kebab was filling and perfectly edible with each bite size gently wrapped in a type of bread that absorbed the tomato and yogurt - it had a very slight spicy kick. The karniyarik eggplant + beef dish was reminiscent of a Mediterranean take on chilli. The rice pudding dessert was a perfect finisher.  The best way to describe it would be a more hearty Indian Kheer with a cinnamon punch!
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: We made our reservation for early dinner last Sunday. The restaurant was nice and quiet when we walked in (I'm not a fan of loud restaurants).Our food was EXCELLENT!We ordered;Hummus (5/5) It's so creamyHunkar Begendi (4.5/5) Leg of lamb chunks are very tender but it can get a little dry out if you take too long to eat it. Kofte (10/5) one word... Bomb! This might be the best beef patties I've ever had! Musakka (5/5) we ordered it to-go for my mother in-law. It's one of her favorite foods. She really liked it even tho she didn't eat it until the next day. If she's happy, we're all happy. Lol..The service was top notch. Very attentive. Never have to ask for anything. We'll probably be back here again (too many other restaurants to try). Until then...

SentimentText: A completely unplanned visit in the vicinity bought my husband and I to Tuba Turkish Restaurant. It was a Saturday night and we showed up without a reservation. There were a couple names ahead of us in the waiting list and we reached during peak dinner hours so our wait was quite long (around 40 mins).But as soon as we got a table, the service was quick and we got our order pretty soon. One bite of the FALAFEL and we realized that our 40 minute was completely worth it. It was the perfect flavor-packed fritter with a crisp cover. The bed of Hummus on the side was also delicious.We also got the SIGARA BOREGI which was basically fillo dough stuffed with potatoes, feta cheese, parsley. It was a slightly on the blander side for me but my husband loved it.And since my husband is a vegetarian, we got the MUSAKKA to share. It was unlike any of the Musakkas I've had so far. Eggplant stuffed with the holy trinity of potatoes, zucchini, and mozzarella cheese and topped with béchamel sauce - this dish was a showstopper! The rice and salad served on the side went perfectly well with the eggplant.Not to forget, the complimentary BREAD PLATE served in the beginning is really good too!I am definitely going back to sample more dishes from their menu. Highly recommend for some amazing Turkish food!
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: I was so looking forward to dining at Tuba.  Well, it's not at all what I thought it was going to be.  Located in a somewhat residential part of Mission district, next to a couple of other restaurants, it's small, nice and dark, and basically non-descript.  It could be a steakhouse or a Z Gallerie exhibit, it didn't ring anything resembling Turkish.  Bottomline, it didn't transport me (and that's what I liked most in ethnic dining).  No music, no dancing, and no special décor.  So food, service, vibe, and energy is what's left to enjoy, and judge further.Service=======...is a high-point.  Our waitress (didn't catch her name, and it wasn't listed on the receipt) was pleasant, helpful, and very nice...despite how over time, the restaurant became more and more busy.  She didn't change negatively or rushed at all.  She took her time to answer questions, and recommend.  My party of 4 were talkative, and asked many things over the evening.The food========Smallish menu, but more than a tough decision to choose from all categories:1.  We elected to try the Sampler Plate ("Tuba Meze Tabagi"), an 8 item cold meza plate.  Expensive, but it went very fast with 4 hangry folks.  All was good, but my favorite was the Cevizli Ezme, mainly a mixture of walnuts and red pepper paste.  [$25, 4.0 stars]2.  I vacillated between 3 entrees, so the waitress was nice enough to recommend the Adana Kebab.  Wrong choice!  One kebab, well done, tougher than wood.  Seasoned nice and slightly spicy, I liked the riceand charbroiled assortment of vegetables.  But was too pricy for one kebab, and really not good.  [$22, 2.5 stars]Vibe & Energy============Both good.  Every seat in the place was taken, loud with big talkers.  Music could be more present.  Overall, I liked.Conclusion==========The food wasn't that impressive on this night [~3.25 stars], rounded up because it's far from average on all other categories.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: I wish this place were better... Judging from the past reviews and the pictures, I could not wait to try out tuba. The appetizers were phenomenal actually! For appetizers we had baba ghanouj, kibbe (ball shaped ground meat), and their complimentary bread. Who doesn't love free bread? And I was pleased with the Kibbe which came on a bed of labneh! However, the main course was a huge disappointment. It was a skewer of lamb, and came with very little veggies... rice... very paltry! For an entree that was $24+, I was hoping for an extra skewer, or something. So, no, I will not be going back again because it's just too expensive for the value! And if I want good middle eastern food, I could really find another place. The place is also really loud so it's not good for a date either! So the ambiance was mediocre, at best, and the food was yummy, but the price did not match.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: We had a lovely meal at Tuba tonight. The host greeted us warmly and made us feel welcome right away. All of the servers were warm, kind and attentive without being intrusive. The atmosphere was comfortable with pleasant music in the background at a low volume. We started with the mezze combo that seemed expensive at $25. But it was worth every penny. I loved the tzatziki and an eggplant dip. My wife really enjoyed the spinach dip. There was also a tomato walnut spread, another vegetable one with zucchini, beans and salad, hummus and dolmas. A dish of flatbread arrived with a delicious butter, a few olives and a little feta. After we polished that off we were both almost full. Then the entrees came. I had the mousaaka which my wife adored. I've been eating low dairy and it was a bit rich for me. She had the eggplant stuffed with meat and enjoyed it but liked mine better. Both entrees came with wonderful well cooked rice that had some surprise garbanzos in it as well as a generous pile of mixed green salad. The meal was a little pricey but portions were large and we have big appetites - next time I'd get the mezze sampler again and split an entree. As it was we both took Home sizeable leftovers.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: First time at Tuba to celebrate my wife's birthday, and we really enjoyed the meal. We were immediately welcomed and felt at home. The appetizers all looked great, so rather than making a decision we ordered the Tuba Meze Tabagi, which included all the cold appetizers. We enjoyed sampling everything, with our favorite being the Patlican Salatasi (pureed eggplant, very much like Baba Ganoush with a smokey flavor). This was way too much for the two of us so about half of it ended up in a to-go box.For the main course I ordered the Tavuk Sis, a tender chicken skewered chicken. I'm always worried when I order a dish with small chunks of meat that are broiled that the meat will be dried out. That definitely wasn't the case here, with the chicken being juicy and flavorful.My wife ordered the Karniyarik, an eggplant stuffed with ground beef. It was also really tasty.We ended up taking a lot of our food home to enjoy the next evening (between the huge appetizer plate and our generous portions).We opted not to have dessert, but were happily surprised when the entire staff encircled our table and sang happy birthday to my wife, delivering a wonderful chocolate mouse surrounded by a hard chocolate shell (I don't know the name of the dish, I don't see it on their menu). See photo... really special.Service was very good, but we had several people serving us, so a few times communications were crossed.We'll definitely return. It was a very special night, made better by the great food and helpful staff.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: There was something about this food that was just really nuanced. From the dolmades (or whatever the turkish word is for dolmades) which were a lighter filling, 100 percent house made (***most greek places don't make their own cause it's too much of a pain in the neck***), and slightly sweet filling; they were quite delicious. Peynirli Karides: Prawns sautéed with tomatoes and garlic in pepperoncini sauce and topped with feta cheeseThis prawn dish was quite delicious. I can't express how much of the leftover broth I soaked up with any given carb that was within arm's reach.There are a few things you notice if you read through the entirety of the menu. I'll start off with the odd one: there is mozzarella used in a number of dishes. One of those dishes we decided to order: HünkarBegendiPureed eggplant with mozzarella cheese and garlic, topped with leg of lamb chunks in red sauce. This was NOT a mistake by any means. The pureed eggplant had just such a beautifully punchy taste that didn't lack for a second of eggplant flavor and/essence. Eggplant was the star of that puree. For me, mozzarella and Turkish didn't really compute. But when the dish came to the table and I got to taste it... the likeness worked it's math like a mathematician at a trigonometry convention. I also got to try the 3 day marinated legs of lamb. Flippin delicious.These were the stand out dishes. I also did get to try the Icli KofteThe FalafelShrimp EntreeThese were less standouts than the aforementioned dishes. Fried items like the falafel and Icli Kofte tended to be a bit drier than I'd have hoped. The Shrimp entree was good (Shrimp were cooked very well), but in comparison to the lamb chops or eggplant dish, which were so incredibly strong, paled peripherally. Wouldn't hesitate to make my way back. I'd love to try the Lamb Kebab, Moussaka, Cevizli Ezme (which several Yelpers are referring to as their signature appetizer).
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Teeny tiny spot packed with a ton of flavor! I'm definitely a fan of Tuba's authentic, flavorful menu. I was there with a relatively large group, so we ordered a bunch of appetizers to start with: stuffed grape leaves, hummus, falafel (served flattened rather than in balls, which was interesting -- still good!), a shrimp dish, and a fried ball with meat inside... I can't remember the name. All was very tasty -- I liked that the grape leaves had a touch of sweetness, and while it's relatively difficult to mess up hummus, Tuba's is smooth and creamy and tahini-y and scrumptious.For my main, I had trouble choosing between the salmon and the lamb chops, but ended up getting the latter and was very happy with my choice. It was excellent -- they didn't actually ask how I'd like the meat cooked, but it came out as a perfect medium/medium-rare which I was very happy with. Super flavorful -- I was literally sucking the bones to get as much meat off as I could. It was served with a handful of roasted veggies and some rice on the side, which tasted good but I thought could have been a little more robust in portion and presentation.Overall, an excellent experience at Tuba! It's clearly the place to be, I even ran into someone I know from back home in Northern VA -- totally randomly! -- while there. I would happily return for more deliciousness upon a future trip, especially to try the salmon (which some of my coworkers ordered, and it did look fab!)
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Came here for a team dinner with a bunch of co-workers and immediately knew I was going to be impressed. The staff was extremely accommodating of our group even though it was a little bigger and made sure we were all seated and comfortable. This place isn't the biggest so keep that in mind if you come with a bigger than usual party size, luckily we had a reservation.Our group ordered a plate of most of the main dishes and a bunch of starters as well to try out. We also ordered a few bottles of wine which were all pretty great, I'm a Pinot Noir guy myself and enjoyed what they had. Everything was delicious but the Lamb sticks out to me as one of the things I really loved. I also liked the Eggplant dish that they had on the menu!

SentimentText: Really chill ambiance and excellent service. They were super attentive to our large group and were able to answer any questions we had. We ordered a handful of apps. I absolutely love grape leaves, but always find them to be too mushy. Very few and far between places have an excellent one. This place fell in the mushy category. I was bummed.But my main order, lamb chops, were cooked perfectly. They were juicy and tender, with a good portion. I thought the side of veggies and rice fell a little flat. The veggies really didn't taste like anything at all. The rose I ordered was a perfect pairing for this type of food though, and I'd strongly suggest the drier one if that's what you're into. I would totally be into stopping by again and seeing if some of the other main dishes are a win.

SentimentText: I had the opportunity to grace this place twice. First time, we were a group and came without reservations. Even though there were quite a few empty tables when asked upon being seated at the end of the tables that the front ones were left for reservations-didn't see anyone till the end of our prolonged dinner when we decided to splurge some more for dessert. I found this sketchy-judgemental maybe?On the second visit, I came after a friend already scored a table near the front without any reservations. Very big eyebrows raised here.First time, ordered a lot of food. Had the combo mezze which was delicious! The hummus not necessarily as flavorful as the rest. Dolmas were more on the sweeter side due to spices and ingredients used.Lamb chops were well marinated and tasty. Meal portions and presentation was on point during both visits so a score here!The eggplant with ground meat was good too although a little too much on the tomatoey side.The kefta kabob I barely tasted as I wasn't sure if it contained bulgur-that small bite wasn't tasty for me.The hot tea was a presentation on its own by the way it's served.  do this!The Turkish coffee was tried by a companion and it also seemed lavish with its own small plate of sweets.I didn't enjoy the kunafe as much bc I think I confused it with the sweet cream wardat (which I absolutely loved and enjoyed in Istanbul)Second time I went I kept it basic. Had the lentil soup which was nice. The falafel and hummus plate wasn't as satisfying. My friend didn't like her dish either (meatballs with yogurt)-she thought it also didn't have much taste.I might return in the future but I think I've tried a lot of their dishes. Service is otherwise friendly but I didn't like the discerning seating choices based off of dress. Hello, this is freakin SF.

SentimentText: Being Turkish and having spent my entire life eating my mom's home cooked Turkish food .. I might come across as a bit biased here but I was not a fan of Tuba. My boyfriend and I have recently moved to San Francisco from NYC and decided that we wanted to get our Turkish fix on so we did what we do best - start reading Yelp reviews. It seemed that Tuba was the best rated out of a handful of places.We made a reservation and although we had a reservation we had to wait a little bit to get seated - which is ok. The place was packed and we thought 'This must be a great sign!'We were super underwhelmed with the food. My boyfriend ordered a Beyti and I got an Adana Kebab alongside the meze sampler. The meat just did not have any flavor, the rice was bland and mushy, and the mezes did not resemble the Turkish flavors at all. Overall we felt like we were eating anything but Turkish food.We decided to not give up on the place and order dessert - Kunefe. A big nope once again. It wasn't crispy and overall just mushy.The bread was ok and we loved that we can get some Efes which is why I'm going with 2 stars here.

SentimentText: Easy to make reservations on Yelp, yummy food, and a cozy atmosphere. Come here for Mezes and Kebabs for 2-4 people. I like this better than Troya.Tuba Meze Tabagi: Since we could not decide on which meze appetizer to get, we opted for the sampler. Wow this was filling and yummy. Everything was amazing to eat and frankly it filled us up so much we could not finish our entrees. Probably better to share amongst 4 people rather than 2.Sarma Beyti Kebab: Presentation is just on point. This is a wonderful dish to look at and eat. The garlic yogurt sauce complements the tomato sauce on the adana kebab. Just gorgeous. Adana Keba: The standard ground beef kebab mixed with bell peppers and accompanying sides. Very tasty! Coffee with Turkish Delight: Wonderful way to finish the dinner. The waiter will swing the coffee pot around and serve - always makes us smile.Why is this 4 and not 5 stars? We came here on a hot September day with Yelp reservations and were lucky to be seated outside where it was a lovely 75 F outside. Everybody on the inside kept shooting us jealous looks, as the inside of the restaurant felt like 90 F - you could literally feel the heat emanating from the restaurant to the outside. However there were only two tables outside which could seat 2 per table, so any party over 2 automatically sat inside. It got so hot that a large party of 6 asked to relocate themselves to the outside so as to feel more comfortable, resulting in chairs and tables spilling over onto the adjacent storefront and sidewalk. I think it might be worth investing in A/C for those hot days.

SentimentText: So, I know very little about Turkish food - it's a lot like Greek - which is a good thing.The cold appetizer sampler is the way to go. It was really quite good sized - and here is where they made their keep - they bring you as much bread as you want to go with it. :) The dip with tomato in it and the spinach one were my favorite, but they were all good. My husband liked the baba ganoush the best. For three of us it went a long way.I got the baked eggplant with the ground beef in it (I can't remember any of the names of things - I couldn't pronounce any of them at the restaurant either). The meet was very flavorful. I couldn't really taste the eggplant at all though. Plenty of it - had to take some home.My brother go the lamb on the pureed eggplant, that was also good - nicely flavored lamb.It wasn't a cheap meal, but the portions were healthy and the quality off food was good, so no complaints. One thing that was a little funny: None of the servers seemed to speak awesome English? Which wasn't a problem, and I suppose is authentic, but it was a little strange. Quite a few people there on a Tuesday night - but we were still able to bet a table. But it's relatively intimate.

SentimentText: Wow! Blown away by this delicious meal. We we're pleasantly surprised how delicious the food was from start to finish, and the impeccable service (harder to come by!) myself and my boyfriend dined here on a Saturday night and it was packed! I would make a reservation. The complimentary bread is delicious it comes with a few small sides (olives, feta, oil) delicious to use for your appetizers too. We ordered the red pepper cold meze it's true signature dish. We found it to be delicious! Very different and unique flavor and veggie friendly. Can easily be shared among 2-4 ppl. We also ordered the stuffed beef shells, which were also delicious! Cake with 2 and they can easily be halved and shared. The flavors were scrumptious. For or main we shared the Adnana beef kabob. It was absolutely delicious! It's perfect to share given all the appetizers, bread and shareable food. I'm sure this could be eaten solo but with two of us sharing so many items this made sense. The kabob was juicy and flavorful! Highly recommend.We were so full we passed on dessert but did order the Turkish tea. We have an awesome Turkish server, she was so friendly and kind she actually brought over a baclava and ice cream. It was ever so sweet and perfect amount to share. We were blown away by her service and we rarely see this sort of service at all so all in all we found this to be w highlight.Definitely come here it's amazing and affordable with options for everyone! Also great for small groups!

SentimentText: I made a reservation here at 6pm on a Sunday through Yelp (which by the way is super convenient). That probably wasn't so necessary as the restaurant was still quite empty at 6 and there were plenty of two-person tables. The place did become quite filled by the time we left around 7pm. It was muggy outside and the heat carried into the restaurant which unsurprisingly does not have AC. SF is not equipped for this kind of weather. It thankfully cooled down as the sun set. The flavors of the dishes we had were all delicious but the amount of food felt incredibly small. Portion control, I guess. The service was excellent. The complimentary flatbread they bring out was yummy and perfect for eating with the accompanying seasoned butter, olives, and feta as well as the cold mezes. We also used the bread to pick up the oils from the mezes. The waitress brought us another basket presumably after seeing us wolf down the first plate of bread.     KIZARTMA (Cold Meze)This appetizer came in two mounds of pan-fried eggplant, bell peppers, and zucchini topped with tomato sauce. (Both mezes came in twos actually.) I loved the natural sweetness of the vegetables (technically fruits but you know what I mean). And they were chopped and cooked to perfection. The small scoops left me craving more. CEVIZLI EZME (Cold Meze)A mix of walnuts, Turkish red pepper paste, tomato paste, fresh garlic, olive oil, and cumin, this  signature meze had incredibly deep flavor. It was a wonderful blend of sweet and savory. The walnuts added a nice, nutty texture. I was surprised by how much I enjoyed this combination of ingredients. I also appreciated the bed of spinach.  ADANA KEBABA succulent kebab of spicy ground beef with lamb mixed with green and red bell peppers. The meat was very tender and easy to chew. I didn't think it was spicy at all. The portion was extremely small and probably not worth the price. It did come with rice and grilled and pickled vegetables which took up most of the plate.  KARNIYARIK (Signature Entree)My favorite out of the two entrees. Even though there was half of a whole eggplant, I wished there was more of it. The baked eggplant was wonderfully tender, but its subtle flavor was overpowered by the ground beef, tomatoes, onions, and chopped parsley stuffing which was exceptionally seasoned. The flavor was very rich and deep. I could see it pairing quite well with pasta. Although I appreciate leafy greens, the salad was a bit boring. All in all, I had a very enjoyable and hearty meal here. Everything was so flavorful and aromatic. I noticed that prices have gone up by $2 for the Cold Mezes and $3 for the Signature Entrees based on the menu posted in 2014 which is somewhat more reasonable than another place I went to that started raising their prices within a month. If you checkin with Yelp, you can get $5 off your tab! This restaurant also partners with Delta and every dollar spent earns you Skymiles!
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: FAN-freakin-TASTIC!  I got there a little early but thankfully it was not so packed at the time. The ambience was wonderful, very calm I must say. We were greeted immediately so that was a change of pace. We got the appetizer from the "cold meze" menu and it was the Haydari and later got two entrees.  Those entrees were MASSIVE!  Completely filling and the dessert didn't do ya wrong either.  We got Kunefe which consisted of sweet cheese, ice cream, pretty much the better and softer version of baklava.  Definitely a must go!

SentimentText: I had a pretty lackluster, disappointing experience at Tuba last night. It's been on my list of places to try for quite some time now, so my friend and I decided to check it out. Looking at the menu beforehand, I was excited to try new Turkish dishes in an authentic atmosphere. However, when I walked in, the vibe felt a bit stale and generic. We were sat at a very wobbly table, which our sever fixed after we pointed it out. Less than five minutes after we got sat, our server asked us what we wanted to order. Our menus hadn't even been opened! We asked for a few minutes, and then decided to share: - Haydari: Cucumbers, mint and dill with creamy thick garlic yogurt. This was by far my favorite dish that we ordered. Creamy, refreshing, with a ton of flavor. They also brought over some really good bread.- Peynirli Karides: Prawns sautéed with tomatoes and garlic in pepperoncini sauce and topped with feta cheese. Very disappointing dish. A few very small shrimp in a watery tomato "sauce". Had little to no flavor and maybe five small pieces of feta.- Falafel Salatasi: Falafel stuffed with goat cheese, served with mix greens, cilantro, basil, red onions and orange vinaigrette. Big bowl of mixed greens with three small falafel. Tomatoes and cucumbers were nice, but otherwise just a basic house salad. No added herbs or flavors.All in all, the food did not seem authentic. No spices, no heat, just very basic stuff. Service was basically nonexistent and we had to ask multiple times for extra bread for our first dish. Prices reasonable for SF but steep for what you get.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Awesome food and service! Falafel Salatasi: The Falafel are stuffed with goat cheese. Very good. Served with a bunch off mix greens, cilantro, basil, red onions, cucumbers and cherry tomatoes. The Orange Limon Mint Vinaigrette was really goodThe Marinated lamb chop dish was one of the best I've had.  It's served rice with garbanzo and grilled veggies,  pickles, grilled yellow pepper and mint yogurt sauce. Sarma Beyti Kebab is awesome! It is Adana kebab wrapped in lavas bread, sliced up and served with really good tomato sauce on top and then a yogurt sauce in the middle. It is garnish with a grilled yellow pepper, which gives the right amount of heat if you eat a little with each bite. Good stuff!The complementarity bread is also really good,  love the butter mixture they serve with it. Wish they served more. The black sesame seeds add a nice touchGreat place, can't wait to come back and try more
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Serhat was the man of the hour! He's the POC and the co-owner of this successful restaurant. Even though it was my friend Mindy's birthday!Ordered: Appetizers * Tuba Meze Tabagi x 2* Içli Köfte (Spicy ground beef) x 2Entrees* Samon x 2* Sea Bream x 1* Karides Tava x 2Special Entrees* Kuzu Lamb Chops / Pirzola x 2* Sarma Beyti Kebab x 2* Adana Kebab x 2Dessert* Kunefe x 3Tina's Travel and Tabloid- Dinner total was $503 with tax and 20% tip as we were a big group- Exceptional service and attention to detail with really quick and fast at delivering - Super accommodating as we upped our reservation number by 2 from 15 to 17, which makes a difference when your restaurant is limited on spacing! - Friend and I made up the menu before we came minus the desserts. I had a little pow wow with Serhat before I put in the order with suggestions of quantities and what we should order. We even go a pyramid noisette chocolate hazelnut along with a birthday song on the house for this celebration.- The workers and Serhat was so nice - taking pictures for us, coming to check on our table, and most importantly served a fantastic meal throughout the night. - We got some entertainment along with the meal of Turkish candy aka Turkish delight (rahat lokum) and Turkish coffee! The coffee swung the thing around like it wasn't going to fall off that platter.- I wouldn't have it any other way. We celebrated the night away! Thank you Serhat and staff for making it memorable.

SentimentText: On Saturday night six of us dined at Tuba in the Mission district of San Francisco.  Located near the corner of Guerrero St. and 22nd St. , Tuba is an upscale Turkish restaurant. Nice ethnic Turkish decor. The restaurant is very busy and probably best to have reservations as I saw some walk in customers get turned away. The menu has the popular Turkish items and that night had a special lamb shank, which was the best dish of the night. It was fall of the bone tender and full of flavor. Our table had the Adana Kabob, Musukka, Lamb Chops, and Karnyark as our entrees all were good. We wanted to order the fish that was in the pictures but they were out of that. The appetizers of dolmas and the pureed eggplant were meh. Service was excellent and attentive.  The minuses are the menu is very pricey for what you get with entrees starting at $24 . A minor observation was the plating of each dish was almost like a cafeteria tray without the dividers.  I am not sure if that's the Turkish style of food plating but it was odd. Parking is hard in the Mission but I was able to find a spot a block away. The food was good and the service was excellent.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: 4.5 starsTuba is an absolute gem!  It was the perfect answer to my craving lately for Mediterranean food.   This is a really good restaurant for regular dinner, a celebration, or a family meal.  The restaurant offers a selection of hot and cold mezes, soups and salads, entrees and desserts.  Let's not forget the specials of the day (these are specials you really want to pay attention to).  Many of of the items are vegetarian and/or gluten free.  They serve wine and beer, but no cocktails.  The restaurant itself is on the small size but it never felt crowded.The food is simply prepared but with really fresh ingredients.  I thought the dishes we ordered were incredibly healthy and tasty.  Make sure to ask about the specials (did I already say that?).  On the night of my visit the specials were lamb shank and sea bream.  The fish was really fresh.We started our meal with an order of their signature meze, the Cevizli Ezme, which is a dip made of walnuts, red pepper paste, tomatoes and various spices.  It was thick and creamy and the perfect start to the meal when spread on bread.For the entrees we shared the Adana kebab and the roasted sea bream.  The single kebab was described as spicy but I didn't find that to be the case.  However, it was flavorful and moist.  The dish came with some vegetables, pickles, a yogurt sauce and rice.  The fish was delicious, fresh and perfectly cooked.  They offered to debone it for us but still presented it as if it were whole.  The sea bream came with a salad, vegetables and pickles.  Cups of turkish tea and a plate of Kunefe, sweet cheese coated in shredded phyllo soaked in syrup and nuts rounded out the meal.  The dessert wasn't too sweet or too rich and paired well with the earthiness of the tea.The portions sizes were just right and I felt the prices were fair for the quality of the meal.  Service was friendly and efficient.  The restaurant was full the entire time of our visit and service never lapsed.The restaurant is located in what I regard as the quieter section of the Mission such that parking was fairly easy (okay, I really lucked out).   I would regard this as a neighborhood spot I would gladly cross the city to visit.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Such a great experience.  The food is authentic and tasty.  Servers are genuine and sort of hover around to make sure your needs are met, but not in an overbearing kind of way.  They give suggestions and are helpful.  Food is not cheap, but completely worth it.  We got the lamb chops medium and they were tender and seasoned perfectly.  Sweet cheese dessert was amazing.  Definitely coming back!  Establishments in SF don't have to be great to get business or to be busy and you get sort of used to being an unappreciated customer, but not so here.  All of the staff we encountered were kind and genuine, food and atmosphere on point; this is what makes a great restaurant.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Came here for dinner and didn't expect this place to be as busy or romantic as it was!We only had to wait briefly for a table for two, and I was a bit taken aback by the abrupt way we were greeted: "do you have a reservation" followed by "please wait outside." That was the only rough patch of the night. Once we were seated, service was fantastic, courteous, and food was beautifully plated and flavored.I've never had Turkish food before, so I was completely in love with the meze plate (cold platter of all the dips and an endless bread basket of their deliciously soft sesame bread. I could live off of that stuff forever! We got the fish special (not on the menu) and found out it was BREAM! Haven't had that before...but it was cooked to perfection, and we chose to dine with the bone in--best option. We also shared the large "light" Turkish beer. We wanted the dark one, but they ran out of it, and surprisingly the light was something I'd totally order again! I don't like lagers or pilsners, but this lager had a hint of honey and was so floral, I loved it.Service was top-notch. They clear your dirty plates and smile/hold eye contact with you to the point before you start feeling uncomfortable. Hah, but I'd totally go back again. Surprisingly it was not as expensive as I thought it would be with the lofty decor and old-school vibes, which is great for a fancier night out without the pomp and circumstance!Hats off to Tuba, so glad we came here.
Label: Genuine

Definitely deserves the Michelin star! Roof was packed! We made a reservation, thank god! The staff was so very nice, so accommodating, would come and ask us how everything was, and would answer our questions regarding the menu. Appetizers:Cevizli Ezme Walnuts, this red paste walnut dish :p sooo goooood! Içli Köfte Bulgur- a ball of spicy ground beef on top of a garlic yogurt :P Yummy! The bread was so good, eating it with the appetizers. We all even ordered the Yogurt drink, so creamy and delicious! Entree's:Tavuk Sis, chicken skewers Köfte, Miniature beef pattiesKarniyarik Eggplant and ground beef dish! The special -Lamb chops. it was so tender!Dessert: turkish tea turkish coffee Ice cream covered with this semolina wheat concoction and pine nut! Great with coffee and tea! As a group we all shared the dishes and it was worth it trying all of them! I am DEFINITELY COMING BACK TO THIS PLACE when I visit again! Great staff, great atmosphere and amazing food!

SentimentText: Rating: 4.5! Great little spot with some very great tasting food! Came here on Friday evening with a group of 6 and we were immediately seated, as we had a reservation for 7:00pm. When we arrived, the restaurant wasn't full, but over time it filled up quickly. As soon as we ordered the appetizer platter, it was out in less than 10 minutes. We decided that we were trying the Tuba Meze Tabagi, which was a combination of all the cold appetizers. We definitely didn't go wrong with this choice, because each item on the platter was incredible and absolutely delicious. For the entrees we each ordered our own. Some of the items that we tried were the Karidesli Salata, Karides Tava, Tavuk Sis, Adana Kebab, HünkarBegendi. Each item had its own peculiar taste and was exceptional. For the chicken and ground beef and lamb kebobs I expected their to be at least two skewers, so the portions were pretty small. The eggplant entree was absolutely mouthwatering and the lamb chunks were super tender. Overall it was a great experience. One minor thing that was slightly annoying was that it felt like we were being rushed the entire evening.  Every time that we sat back and conversed amongst the table, the host/hostess assumed we were finished eating and would come up and start clearing our table. Other than that, the service was great!
Label: Genuine
text1: rating 45 great little spot with some very great tasting food came here on friday evening with a group of 6 and we were immediately seated as we had a reservation for 700pm when we arrived the restaurant wasnt full but over time it filled up quickly as soon as we ordered the appetizer platter it was out in less than 10 minutes we decided that we were trying the tuba meze tabagi which was a combination of all the cold appetizers we definitely didnt go wrong with this choice because each item on the platter was incredible and absolutely delicious for the entrees we each ordered our own some of the items that we tried were the karidesli salata karides tava tavuk sis adana kebab hünkarbegendi each item had its own peculiar taste and was exceptional for the chicken and ground beef and lamb kebobs i expected their to be at least two skewers so the portions were pretty small the eggplant entree was absolutely mouthwatering and the lamb chunks were super tender overall it was a great experience one minor thing that was slightly annoying was that it felt like we were being rushed the entire evening every time that we sat back and conversed amongst the table the hosthostess assumed we were finished eating and would come up and start clearing our table other than that the service was great

SentimentText: NOT WORTH YOUR TIME or $$$!!! For folks traveling or thinking this is amazing food based on other Yelp reviews, go read the negative ones first. Either I'm very fortunate to have had AMAZING middle eastern food or other folks haven't been exposed to real authentic food and service. Trust me, there's way better food out there. I really wish I hadn't come to this place. Food: Portions are amazingly small, rice tasted bland with no color or flavor (other places I've tried have "jeweled rice" or at least it's flavorful). Their Chicken dishes were burnt, bland, and dry. The very few vegetables I got on my plate looked more like decorations rather than part of my meal. Hummus was okay, but their bread came out cold. We tried Baklava for dessert...disappointing to say the least so we didn't finish it. I've had much better and authentic in the Bay Area. Service: Restaurant is overwhelmingly understaffed and they don't know how to manage the restaurant. Don't expect the multiple hosts to tell you the truth about wait times. The night we went had no host so different servers had to fill in. That's crazy for a busy weekend. SEVERAL parties outside (in the cold) had "reservations," yet no tables were available for even a small party. They kept telling all of us waiting that the people inside were "taking too long to finish." The restaurant needs to honor reservations or else state it's walk-ins only. Ambience: WAY too SMALL space, crowded, too loud of music, and worst of all, table set up is horrendous!! I know SF is tight in space, but man this was disappointing based on the pictures. The restaurant staff was assembling tables like a jigsaw puzzle to make people fit into unimaginable spaces. No one could walk comfortably, much less get out if needed for an emergency. At some point the middle walkway was blocked! This was just an uncomfortable situation. How embarrassing to call this authentic Turkish restaurant. Nowhere can this be authentic in Turkey! I'm sorry to say this, but I would be embarrassed to call this place my restaurant.
Label: Genuine

Some suggestions to the lady at the front deskFirst, when you screwed up the reservation, instead of telling me we don't have your reservation repeatedly, maybe you can see if you can do something about it and find out what is the root cause, especially after I supply all the information. It's quite funny to being talked to as if I am in the wrong here. And if you are the manager, then I am wondering why there is another manager later asking nicely if I can change my review to reflect the fact that you did eventually fix the reservation screw up.

SentimentText: I am from Turkey and having lived in a few different countries I know how hard it is to find a restaurant that can make Turkish food that tastes and looks like you are eating back in Turkey. The team at Tuba were very friendly, managed to sort a table for a very large group I was with with less than a week's notice and they were very attentive and quick when we were in the restaurant. Most items on the menu are authentic. Falafel and humus are the two items that I would say are more middle eastern in general rather than really Turkish, but that depends a little where in Turkey you are from. The dishes we ordered tastes all really good even though some deviated a little from how I know the dishes in Turkey.I only wish that they had some more options on their menu (I appreciate that this isn't that easy unless you have a much larger restaurant & kitchen). I would also recommend them skipping some items like the peynirli karides which I never order in Turkey either as it really isn't the tastiest dish (especially if you are dealing with a crowd in SF that can get great shrimp dishes with king/tiger shrimp in other places). Another thing I missed is Raki. I know it's a licensing issue but would really love to have seen this on the menu. The availability of the Turkish wines (made from Turkish grape varieties) definitely made up for the lack of raki though.One of the best Turkish meals I had outside of Turkey and can really recommend highly for those that want to taste Turkish food for the first time or those missing the food from back home.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Excellent Turkish food!  We stopped by on a Sunday night to eat dinner.  WE had an amazing plate of mixed appetizers -- creamy spinach, eggplant with red peppers, fantastic paste of red pepper and walnuts and tomato -- all atop a white bean salad.  Delicious!  Then our main courses included a terrific skewered spicy ground beef with lamb hot and bursting with juices, prawns and asparagus in a lemon sauce, and tomato lamb with eggplant puree.  A terrific meal with great service.

SentimentText: Our love for Tuba never ends! This place is amazing.. great food, quality with fabulous service. What's not to love? I've tried most of their appetizers here and my favorites are haydari ( which is the yogurt with dill) Icli kofta (on the hot mezzas) and their signature mezza( it's a mix of crushed walnuts, As for the entrees, we usually get the Adana kebab. It's spicy but very tasty. Their lamb shank is also wonderful. It comes with 4 large pieces of lamb shank, side rice, veggies, yogurt and pickles. These are the same sides for the Adana kabab. They bring their home made bread as well along with a bit of butter, olive oil and feta cheese. It's so good! They have highlighted their gluten free items on their menu. ( that's an added bonus for us) If you order a couple of their appetizers, you can easily share one of their entrees unless u are very hungry! Their portions are on the large side. And to finish your meal off, order the incredible Turkish coffee!
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Warm, comforting atmosphere, with delightful Turkish cuisineIf you're looking for a different dining experience in San Francisco's Mission District, you won't find a better place than Tuba. Like the name implies, the restaurant serves authentic Turkish cuisine and it is outstanding! I went there with some friends for dinner last night and we couldn't have been more pleased. The lamb chops are delicious; some of the best I have ever tasted. My wife ordered Adana Kabab (spicy ground meat) which also was wonderful.The service is friendly and efficient; the ambience low key and very welcoming. Prices are moderate. The only downside I might say is the wine list. A bottle of Turkish wine is priced at $59, which in my opinion is rather high. You might be better off to forget about authenticity stick with a basic California white or red.But, what really makes Tuba such a pleasant place to have dinner are the servers. The entire staff is wonderful!
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: This place is incredible. Hands down the best Turkish food I've had, and I've been a diehard fan of Mediterranean/Turkish food for a decade, with plenty of travel to taste traditional dishes. Wines are also good -- try especially the Kocabag (red). Beyond the food it's clear that the place is deeply cared for, the waiters enjoy their work and provide great service, and a lot of love is put into the food and setting. It's not a fancy spot like Kokkari -- nothing pretentious about it, just good ambient light, good vibe, grounded energy. Perfect for friends and family time and relaxed date nights (and lots of great venues nearby to keep things going after).Make reservations ahead of time to get a good table!

SentimentText: We were trying to get into Kokkari, but couldn't get a reservation and ended up here instead. So glad we did! Food: Overall the food was delicious. We're vegetarians, and there was more than enough food to leave us stuffed and with leftovers for the next day. We ordered the cold mezze platter, falafel, siguri, and moussaka. The siguri was the only thing that was skippable in this. Otherwise the food was amazing. We also tried the Turkish rose and white wines, which were quite good if you like more dry wines. Service: The service was friendly and good. However, it would've been nice if the staff had more knowledge of the wines. All we got was dry, light/medium-bodied, and fruity. They struggled to describe beyond that. That being said, we did like the wines they recommended. We will definitely go back.

SentimentText: I was lucky enough to be introduced to Tuba by a good friend.  Decided to go back the other day and wasn't disappointed!We ended up getting wine and dessert which put us in the $$$ category per person, but we knew what we were getting into.The cold platter was an excellent way to start the meal and something that I will continue to get each time I come here.  It is the perfect starter for three, but could be overwhelming for two.From there we got the braised lamb shank, which fell off the bone.  The one we usually get on the menu, is the marinated lamb chops, which is equally fantastic.  Baklava with turkish tea for me to round off the meal was a great finish.

SentimentText: In between $$-$$$ place. The complimentary appetizer is pretty good but I didn't enjoy my entree and other appetizer as much. But this review is specifically towards he service I received this night, extremely unprofessional. I arrived at 10pm and I WELL understand the restaurant closes at 11pm. I was keeping an eye on the clock making sure I leave before 11pm to not be rude, as I understand the servers want to go home too. But they constantly rushed me asking if I wanted a to go box when I wasn't yet finished with my meal at 10:30 and on top of that, I didn't even finish my appetizer HALF WAY and they didn't pack it to go, they threw it away. (At least ask right?). Also, the waitress asked if I wanted to see the dessert menu and didn't give me time to look it over. I asked to just give me 1 more QUICK minute and she replies that the kitchen was supposed to close 10 minutes ago trying to make me feel bad?! Also, 20 minutes into my meal they forgot my iced tea and didn't even apologize. They also dropped the check before we were even ready to leave. LASTLY on the way out, they said thank you so much to the person in front of us but didn't say thank you at all for our business. Btw: this whole experience I stayed nice to them and didn't do anything to tick them off or deserve bad service. EXTREMELY UNPROFESSIONAL AND RUDE !!!
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: How can I convey how perfect my dinner here was? To give you an idea, I usually scarf down my food; a minute or two and even the largest plates are empty. Tonight I wanted every bite to last forever. The service is impeccable too - every server was polite, extremely attentive, friendly and informative and not to mention: beautiful!Whatever your fancy, you just must try the red lentil soup and the falafel. At first bite, the soup left me wanting ; I was waiting for a kick or a spice. At second taste, I was pleasantly overwhelmed at the texture and the layer of ingredients melded together. This was comfort in every bite; this was a rainy night, post breakup, cold season, long day bowl of warm hugs. Am I exaggerating? I felt better about humankind when that bowl was empty - 15 minutes later. My eyes and hands worked my way in circles around the table in every effort to make that soup last. And to my delight, there was so much else to pique my interest. The falafel was the best I've ever had. I'm not an expert in falafel but I've never met a falafel I didn't like. If it's on the menu, I will order it regardless. This wasn't your average falafel though. If there is a falafel heaven, Tuba's is falafel god. The texture was perfect - a slight crunch and flavor that made my tongue dizzy. Butter it up generously with hummus and you don't need anyone else to make it a date.And then came the entree. Our server used the word "juicy" twice in her description of this chicken dish served - in laymen's terms - in tomato sauce and a medley of mushrooms and other accompaniments. She could have used it thrice over and it still would have not sufficed. This chicken is to die for. Every morsel was like reuniting with a long-lost lover. I couldn't finish it. Shock and horror, but I didn't want this night to end! So the friendly girls wrapped it up with some salad (delicious) and bread (divine) and I sauntered home with my meal that would last all night long.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: I went there with my significant other for Valentine's Day yesterday evening. The menu was Prix Fixe, totaling $150 for two people. The extra additions that the restaurant made, including a rose given once the check came, were nice gestures. It was a bit confusing to be told this - "One mezze, soup or salad, one entree, choice of dessert, coffee or tea." We were helped out by the table next to us that had already ordered to tell us that it was one shared mezze, two soup or salad, two entree, two dessert.The bittersweet moment was paying $150 for roughly $100 worth of food. I would be interested in going back when I can choose items from the full menu. It was my fault for not calling the restaurant to clarify if the menu would be Prix Fixe. I would have liked to see that reflected on their website, given the extra steps taken for the occasion.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: This review is past due, and we are STILL thinking about the amazing experience we had at Tuba. No joke. It was my girlfriends birthday, and for weeks prior, I had been wondering where in the heck has she been wanting to spend her "not going to say the age" birthday this year??? So after weeks of racking my brain, as some guys do, I finally just came out and asked her, "where would you like to go for your birthday dinner?". The first thing she said was "TUBA!" (Apparently she's been wanting to check this place out for awhile) Of course, we checked into Yelp first, to see what people thought of this place. We're so glad we listened, because man this place is incredible! Literally every bite, we looked at each other and shook our heads in utter disbelief on how freakin delicious the food is. And the service was just as amazing. They were very accommodating and attentive without being overly in your face. At the beginning, I mentioned to the server that it was my girlfriends birthday and I wondered if they remembered. After we finished our amazing dinner, our server brought out a wonderful complimentary birthday dessert and the entire restaurant staff, including the other guests, sang happy birthday to my sweetheart! Needless to say man, this place is a MUST for anyone looking for impeccable service and amazing food! Would highly recommend to ANYONE.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Stopped by for a late Sunday dinner, the place was pretty full for nearly 9pm but we were greeted and seated promptly.FOOD:Cevizli ezme starter - was fresh and tasty and not at all what I was expecting, based on the description. Comes as two scoops of purée which we ate with the bread that seems to come with every table, but I'm not sure if you're supposed to/it's traditional..? Anyway, we did; do what tastes good amiriteHunkar Begendi main dish - also very delicious, also surprisingly bread-less, surprisingly because it was even less viscous than the starter we got. We tried to ask for more bread, but they had run out that late in the evening. Felt like eating a (thick, tasty) sauce. Could've used a higher lamb : eggplant sauce ratio, too.AMBIANCE:Nice space in a quiet neighborhood. There was a birthday happening and our waiter, upon greeting us, insisted (warned?) that everyone was required to sing. I thought it was sweet of him, but I imagine some people would rather not be forced.OVERALL:4/5; 5/5 with bread
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Tuba is probably the best Turkish food I have ever had in the US and I tasted my fair share of food from a variety of Turkish restaurants including ones in the east coast where the Turkish food scene is much more advanced.It has a nice atmosphere and friendly staff. Food prep time is very reasonable and everything I tried was extremely tasty. My favorite items are Icli Kofte and Ali Nazik. If you go to Tuba with friends, I definitely would suggest sharing a few of their appetizers. Mucver (Zucchini fritters) is also amazing. They have good desserts such as kunefe.I don't really have any cons about this place. It is kind of on the expensive side, like on the upper bound of $$ but I'd argue that it is worth it.

SentimentText: It was good. For the price, it really wasn't all that good. The ambiance is alright, it's pretty basic. A few friends and I came to dinner on a Friday night. Dinosaur bone style!I pretty much cleaned my plate and was super full. I liked it, but my meal and the beer came out to $45. Yikes. Wish I'd come in prepared to blow that much. My partner ordered lamb kebob, which he liked but said was under whelming and not worth the money. Overall, good food but I'd rather go somewhere else any day.

SentimentText: Tuba's Turkish food is as good as it gets. The restaurant's elegant appearance and welcoming staff contributed to our positive experience, and ultimately provided the ideal ending to a fun day of hiking and sightseeing.All of the mezes we ordered were delicious, but the falafel was the most memorable by far. It was served on a bed of hummus, and paired perfectly with their complimentary warm bread. The falafel wasn't greasy or overly dense, and the spices in each piece were very pronounced.The fried eggplant in the Kizartma was fresh, and the dish contained a relatively even amount of eggplant distributed among the bell peppers and zucchini. And while the portion was small, it was still satisfying.I can't speak for the meat dishes, such as the Içli Köfte, but I can say that all of our plates were polished off by the end of dinner. Visually similar to breaded meatballs or rice balls, the Içli Köfte were stuffed with spicy ground beef and crushed walnuts, covered in bulgur wheat, and pan-fried. The meze includes two big pieces, which doesn't look like a lot, but is sufficient for a couple of people to share.By the time we left Tuba, we were stuffed. We wish we could've ordered additional items from the menu that night, because we weren't disappointed by any of the mezes we tried!
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Ordered the Köfte. It's basically a couple of pieces of slider sized hamburger patties cooked with Turkish spices served with salad. I'm glad it took awhile for it to come out because that meant they freshly prepared it and it showed. Very juicy and the Turkish spices cooked into gave it a nice taste to it. It went well with the Elfes Plisner I ordered for a drink. I'm not sure exactly what type of rice it came with but it was just sticky enough for me. Friendly staff that took their time to make an earnest suggestion about what to order on the menu. The restaurant ambiance was nice but a bit noisy as I found myself almost yelling to have a conversation.I'm not surprised anymore that restaurant is still a fixture in this spot when all the surrounding restaurants in the area have practically come and gone over the years.

SentimentText: I've never had Turkish cuisine but the food here is amazing.  It's a quaint, fashionable small-mid sized restaurant in San Francisco Mission district.The all inclusive appetizer was the highlight of the night.  The flavors were distinct for each item.  The main dish was the Kofta which are grilled beef patties served with grilled veggies.  Normally I go vegetarian - these are worth a try.  Patties are moist on the inside and served with grilled veggies and yogurt dip.  Service was friendly and efficient.  We arrived around 6 on a Thursday night.  At this time not many tables were filled.  But after 1 hour the place was packed so if you want to come, make a reservation on Open Table or Yelp
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: I was really impressed by the food and service here! The atmosphere feels very warm and welcoming. Prices are a little high but well worth it for the quality.They give you free delicious bread to start. For the entree I ordered the Musakka ($22) which was eggplant stuffed with potatoes and zucchini covered with cheese and bechamel sauce. It's served with a small rice and salad. I could not get enough of the rice! It was so flavorful and the texture was perfect. The rest of the dish was filling and very rich from the cheese and sauce. I also tried some of the miniature beef patties from my friend's Kofte ($22) entree and I preferred hers slightly more.Overall wonderful place to get authentic Turkish food!
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: One of us got lamb chops, and that dish was very good, although tiny vegetable serving accompanied it. A few thin slices of carrot, pepper, etc.  Pretty but only enough for a couple of forkfuls.  The other of us got a chicken dish with mushrooms, tomatoes, olives etc.  Other than being too salty, it was a tasty dish spiced to be typical of southern Italian cuisine, not Turkish, which was odd.  Server took my plate to kitchen to put leftovers in a to-go box.  I just got the container out for lunch and found an unappetizing surprise in it.  The rice was criss-crossed with long dark hair.  The server was blonde, so it was hair from somebody else in the kitchen.  Apparently questionable hygiene in the kitchen.  Yuk!  Very disappointing to have to throw out the leftovers instead of having them for lunch.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Okay. I just have to take a second to disagree with the other reviewers who say you don't get a lot for what you pay. We left STUFFED. Between two people, we split the Tuba Meze Tabagi (basically the cold appetizer sampler), Adana Kebab (beef and lamb kabob with grilled veggies), and the Kofte (beef patties with grilled veggies). The appetizer sampler is excellent, though probably better suited for 4+ people (our server told us that, but our eyes were bigger than our appetite). Both entrees were excellent, hot and full of flavor.I must note that this was my first taste of authentic Turkish food, so I am not an expert by any means. But I know what good food is, and Tuba is bound to satisfy. The interior is cozy and intimate, creating a truly authentic dining experience. Highly recommend!

SentimentText: I'm 34, born and raised in California repping a Turkish heritage, and never have I been to a Turkish restaurant Stateside that should actually be in Istanbul (when you walk out, you wish the Bosphorus or Istiklal caddesi was around the corner behind Lone Palm). TUBA serves a meal that would be the highlight of the evening for Turkish friends and family in Istanbul itself, and that doesn't require much by way of imagination. The food is layered with complex flavors that work off each other but don't overwhelm: the food feels classic but not dated. The mezzes are carefully made and memorable (patlican salatasi, cevizli ezme, sigara börek and entrees Adana, pirzola were all memorable). I ate here for the first time last week, and came back excitedly one week later to introduce my friends to Turkish cuisine and culture. Well done.

SentimentText: I was very excited about trying out this restaurant when my Los Angeles friends happened to eat here, and told me they enjoyed this restaurant so much they wished there was one just like it here in Los Angeles. Being from Los Angeles myself, I made sure I visited Tuba Restaurant the next time I came to San Francisco. I called and booked ahead of time. Reserved a table for a party of 9 people. I told them over the phone that I was from Los Angeles and how excited I was about trying their authentic Turkish cuisines. At first glance, the restaurant is chic and cozy, on a cute little street. Street parking was hard to find. Once we sat down, with my American family, I introduced myself to the server and told them that I am Turkish and that I am very excited to be here. I told them about how much my friends had raved about their food, and thus, I brought my whole American family from San Francisco to try their food. We decided to eat family style, with lots of big dishes to share. At first we ordered a bunch of appetizers. So here is the part that drops the stars from 5 to 3: The first combo appetizer plate we get, I take a bite off the spinach dip and there is a hair in it! Immediately I spit it out, quietly, and drop it off to the floor so the rest of my party is not grossed out. But I am now very grossed out and dissapointed. I then call our server and tell her, quietly, in Turkish, that I got hair in my food. She looks at me in disbelief, and instead of apologizing, grabs my plate and brings me a new one. I decide that I am not going to ruin my whole family's experience so I tell no one. After all the appetizers are finished and we move on to the entree, the same server comes back and asks how everything was. I tell her the food was good, and then she says, "well I hope the good food made up for the bad start".  I tell her "yes" and we continue to eat. We order: appetizer platesigara borekseveral plates of lamb, several plates of combination kebabs, MantiTurkish wine, Various deserts: Kunefe, baklava, helva, chocolate pyramidTurkish coffee and turkish tea.Our bill is $500 plus tip.So here is my verdict: 1) Although they had charged us 20% gratuity, they never told us so my husband ended up giving them an additional 20% tip on top 2) Even though the food was great, the hair in my food at the very beginning was a big buzz kill. What was even more annoying was at no point did they attempt to apologize about it. She just kind of looked at me in disbelief. What I expected, instead, was for them to apologize and perhaps bring a desert as a gesture for apology. Generally, in such establishments, that is the right thing to do. Especially for a table this big, who just dropped almost $500 for food, the least you could do is take out a desert or two off the bill as a sweet gesture of apology. Yes, the food was good and the ambiance was lovely. But I wish they had better courtesy.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: We ordered take-out and split two entrees and an appetizer. After placing the online order, we took about 20 mins mosey over before the order was ready, which was expected and only a short wait. The staff were nice as we sat in an empty booth and waited. My brief take of the ambiance inside was it's comfortable, not too dark or pretentious, nice pixel art work.Bread - Four pieces of a soft flatbread with sesame.Mucver - Three little patties of zucchini fritters. I thought they'd be more latke like consistency but they were pillowy on the inside and crispy on the outside. Cheese mixed into which were little pockets of flavor with each bite. Yum, these were my favorite part.Chicken Kebab - Perfectly done kebab, the meat was was tender coated in a flavorful, slightly sour yogurt marinade, meat was juicy inside and not too dry. The grilled vegetables had a nice crunch and had just the right amount of slight charred from the grill. Tzatziki sauce was incredible as well. Portion size a little small (~5-6 chunks of meat). The chicken also came with a cucumber and carrot salad that was a little on the wet side but well seasoned.Kofte - Four smallish patties of beef grilled. Flavorful and smoky but a little too dry for my taste. I added on a lot more tzatziki and to balance it out.The food is really good, the kebabs are among the best I've had. A little pricey for the portion size as a to go option. I'd go back again for the sit in experience and to try other dishes.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: I'm with Priti K. on the price. For 6 people it did end up at almost $50pp and we all only ordered 1 drink each. For the same total price of the bill we all went to dinner with 8 people a few days later at a different restaurant. I was debating between the lamb chops and the special, lamb shank. The waitress recommended the shank over the chops so shank it was. The portion size was huge. The lamb was tender and the sauce was fantastic. It wasn't too gamey which I was a fan of. My meal was good. My hubby ordered the beef/lamb kebab which I thought had pretty good flavor but again the high price tag on it makes you question it's value. Also I'm a little surprised it was a ground beef/lamb combo in the kebab as mediterranean food is heavy on the lamb. Ambience was nice. The chairs were comfy. I didn't feel cramped at the table. The service was interesting. Four of us got there first and about 2 minutes after we sat down the waitress was there trying to get our drink orders. We told her we needed a few minutes as we hadn't even looked at the menu yet and she went on to list the drink menu for us trying to get us to order - it was pushy. We wanted a few minutes to get settled, look at the menu, and talk to each other and catch up on our day. After that she backed off and the rest of the service was good.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Yelp says it was Michelin recommended; however, my bf and I experience nor service was any where near fantastic. First off, our complimentary bread was not served; despite seeing the table next to ours (they came in way after us) enjoying theirs. It wasn't until our food arrived at the table that I had to flag our server to bring us bread because we never got ours. As I should of read from the other reviewers, "service was non existent" seems to be quite true for this restaurant. One of the primary reasons why we wanted to go there was because of the Manti. We saw great reviews and photos; however, when we got there for our 6:15 pm dinner, it was not available. "Sold out" was what the server told us. Ok, a huge disappointment, so instead of deciding to order an appetizer to share and then main entrees, we decided to share a few appetizers. We decided on a few options, Turkish cigars (Sigara Boregi), zucchini fritters (Mucver), meatballs (Icli Kofte), prawns with in tomatoes, feta cheese and garlic in pepperoncini sauce (Peynirli Karides). I specifically asked if that was way too much for us in which our table server responded "that's good." Not once did she tell us it was way too much food for two. Unlike other restaurants, they'll straight out tell you if you ordered way too much and then it's up to the customer to want keep what they have. However, a couple of disappointments led us to a bad experience. Our food came out all at once in tiny small table that could not accommodate all our food. We had no room to eat since the table was jammed packed with four dishes. Given that it was all hot items, we would of enjoyed it if they brought out 2 dishes at a time so we could enjoy it while it was hot, but that was not the case, despite me asking our server if she could possibly not bring it all at once. "Too late" was her response. We didn't even get to enjoy our hot food since it quickly got cold before we could move on to another dish. Not only that, my bf who is Turkish was not impressed with the food. All the dishes were mediocre and nothing beyond fantastic. My bf even made a joke about Michelin recommended huh? Looking over the table next to ours, who got there complimentary bread and olives with their appetizer order; their main entrees took well over 45 mins to arrive. At one point, I heard the couple asking the same server about their main entrees. Now I'm not sure, but this restaurant doesn't know how to service or they don't get their food timing right. Overall, food was 2 stars and service was probably a 1.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: We had gone to this place after reading recommendation from a friend here. When asked our waitress had suggested a Turkish Syrah and a Turkish Cab. We went with the Syrah Sevilen and did not regret at all. They had some decent collection of wine going.For started we had ordered the cold mezze platter and falafel. We did not regret the mezze at all however the falafel plate was slightly shy of salt. For entree, I had gone with their tavuk sis and amongst the six of us we had ordered their eggplant special and beef also. The flavors in the chicken did not do any wonders for me however, the egg plant signature was very delicious. My friends seemed to have like the beef kebab more than the beef sis. We had shared their chocolate mousse for dessert. The dark chocolate thick outer layer in the shape of a small pyramid sealed the deal for us. We enjoyed our dinner and would recommend this place for trying out. Regarding price I would say it's on the steeper side of $$.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: I have not been to Turkey in 5 years, but Tuba magically took me there in a matter of minutes. Their cold mezze platter is worth every penny of the $25 we paid for it! For the entree we did the lamb wrapped in pita with yogurt sauce. The yogurt in general at this place is pretty unreal in the best way possible. The service was stellar, and while the place is small, I did not feel like I needed to yell at my BF ie the noise level is on point. At one point the door was left ajar, and the waiter was quick to close it. I recommend this spot to everyone, except maybe a vegan, as the veggie options were limited.

SentimentText: On a Saturday night I was able to get a last minute reservation but the place was packed.It's a bit noisy and crowded and very stuffy inside, we asked them to open the door which I'm sure those sitting near it didn't love but restaurants without ventilation really annoy me.  The service was very friendly and attentive. We ordered wine and beer and started with Turkish salad, walnut dip and eggplant dip with bread. The salad was great, the tomatoes they used were sweet and ripe and it all took me back to the Mediterranean. The dips were excellent, eggplant smoky and walnut dip absolutely yummy. The bread was out of this world.  We really should have stopped there, we were actually full after.For the main dish we shared the stuffed eggplant, this was very underwhelming, it was all piled together and looked messy and uninspired, the flavor was not there, the only disappointing part of our meal. I get the feeling the appetizers are better in this place.

SentimentText: We came here for dinner last Wednesday and enjoyed the eggplant stuffed with ground beef flavored with Turkish spices and their herb chicken.  Both came in a hot casserole bowl that kept the food hot.  Both dishes came with really good rice pilaf mixed with beans and a generous salad.  We also had Turkish coffee, Turkish delights, and ice cream with baklava.  Everything was good except the Turkish delights which were very hard and had no flavor. Service was slow and when we checked in on Yelp, the bill was reduced in a very convoluted way that we found confusing.  This is a very cute place and the food is high quality and generous in portion. I would come back but it is very small and feels a little uncomfortable, maybe because of the red decor which is not relaxing.

SentimentText: So my friend and I were in the city for a conference and were starved! I was in the mood for Turkish and we looked up some places on Yelp. Tuba was very highly rated and we decided to give it a shot. In all honesty, this was one of the best Turkish restaurants I have ever been to (and I have been to Istanbul), actually, make that one of the best restaurant experiences I have ever had!The place was small but classy. It had a very authentic "Turkish" feel to it. Everything on the menu looked delicious but we decided to order the appetizer sampler (highly recommended!) It was served with some fresh bread hot out of the oven. I went with the Adna Kabob and my friend ordered the chicken mozzarella dish (forgot the name). The food was amazing! In regards to service, the waiting staff was excellent! We definitely felt very special and were well attended to.Overall, an excellent experience that I would definitely repeat when visiting the city.
