We were dismissed several times and had to sit there for a long time. The waitress that finally did come over laughed about the meat. Sorry. I don't find potentially making us sick funny at all.THEN, the thing that botheres me the most: They tried to tell me they were charging me correctly.....     $72 was our total - $18 for the uncooked beef - $12 for baklava we said "forget it" when it never came out- $25 GrouponSimple math. Comes to: $17. Our bill? $38. I just wanted out of there so I paid it to follow after my very angry BF who is Turkish and was embarassed by some of "his people" in this place. It wasnt until later thta I realized the stupid waitress screwed me over. The reason is because they totally screw over their Groupon customers. They take off a percentage NOT the $25 promised. Thank God we did not eat more than we did!!!!!!

SentimentText: OK. I told the folks I would write a nice review about them since they gave us such a great experience.  Tuba is a nice, clean and modern Turkish restaurant, tuck between the Mission District and Noe Valley.  We would never have thought of driving to this neighborhood for dinner had it not for the Groupon deal we got (a plug for Groupon).  My Groupon would have expired to nothing, but the owner extended it for another week so I get to try their restaurant - a good business decision...I haven't had much experience with Turkish food, but I liked what I ate there. The bread was warm and has tiny sesame seeds to make it smell good.  The spiced up whipped butter was perfect for spreading.  We ordered Kofte Kebab (beef and lamb) and Shrimp Scampi - both were delicious and properly done. The vegetables were nicely done and we didn't know how to eat Turkish food, so we dipped everything into everything that was on our plate.  We topped it off with their signature dessert, the Kunefe.  The Kunefe is layered shredded dough, cheese, pistachio, fried to perfection.  It was sweet, but not over sweat, but has an interesting crusty texture for a dessert.  The biggest draw for the this restaurant was the service.  The host and waitress was very kind and attentive.  They were very nice to us.  I read some recent posting that people were annoyed with the service, but I believe it might have been because of the mass number of people arriving during the final day of Groupon expiration.  It's tough running a business, but even tougher when you have impatient customers (I am one of them from time to time).Overall 4 out of 5 Stars-Food - tasty (good tasting food doesn't have to be authentic*)-Menu - simple-Cost - reasonable, not pricey at all-Service - exceptional-Parking - only street parking, so it's a bit difficult to do on weekends.* I know I will get some people gasping for air when I said "good tasting food doesn't have to be authentic" so I want to clear the air.  I believe food is dynamic and can change, as long as it tastes good or better than the original.  However, I do believe authenticity is important for those who missed the taste of their homeland.  If you are tasting food for childhood memories, they have to be authentic.  My mom used to pay a lot of money for not-so-great tasting desserts and fruit.  When I asked her why she would eat something that doesn't taste good, she said the taste and flavor brings back good memories.  Now that my mother has past away, I long for home cooked meals that reminds me of my mother's cooking more than anything restaurants can dish out.  Tabu is a modern restaurant - whether you go there for authenticity or creativity, you must admit, the food there taste pretty darn good
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: This is a wonderful restaurant. Love the family operation! We were a party of 7 and they couldn't do enough for us. Celebrating 3 family birthdays and decided on Tuba as my son lives in the Mission and we wanted to be able to walk to the restaurant. Food and service were terrific! Lots of interesting choices. We had a very early reservation and there were no other guests when we arrived. However, it was packed when we left. Cold Meza combination plate was so yummy, unfortunately, filled up on that. Portions were generous and everyone enjoyed their meal. They provided birthday desserts to all three family members which was awesome.  Plan on coming back even though we live in the East Bay!

SentimentText: Why do restaurants use such tiny tables for two people? I know restaurants can cram a few more tables in by buying tiny tables, but I think it's annoying. Even though there were larger tables for four available all during our dinner, we were seated at a dinky table where we constantly had to be careful not to push something over the edge. Adding to that, they keep a bottle of water on your table, taking up precious space. If the table is so small, why not come by with a water pitcher to refill our glasses? And, then, why serve the food on such large dishes? To make it impressive, I guess. Actually, the food was very good. Salmon was excellent, the shrimp kebab ok. They still don't have a wine list, although are pouring house wine. No decaf coffee either.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: An excellent Turish food restaurant in the Mission! It's thankfully not just a kebab place, which is what keeps opening when I'm seeking out a proper meal. The menu is fairly extensive, everything on it is delicious! We started with this cheese-filled taquito type app, it was different and quite good! The prawn salad had amazingly fresh and flavorful greens and veggies for January - I was floored that even the tomatoes were perfect. The Lamb wrap comes with a great tomato/yogurt sauce, a great menu choice.  Service is friendly and the owner is a total sweetheart that makes you want to return again and again. Right now they are BYOB/BYOW - get up on that while you can.

SentimentText: We had a fabulous experience at Tuba. We were looking for a more casual and different experience from our usual Saturday night and we found exactly what we wanted. The restaurant was full, but they seated us at the bar and managed to make us feel like we were being well taken care of without intruding on our meal or conversation. The food was excellent. In addition to the standard middle eastern staples they had unique Turkish dishes I'd never heard of. I'mA vegetarian so I had ezme - a unique combo of chopped walnuts and this fantastic red pepper paste served with their yummy bread - and the stuffed eggplant, which I just couldn't stop eating. The Boy, a carnivore to the core, had feta prawns and the beef & lamb kabob. He thoroughly enjoyed them both and almost licked his kabob plate clean. Oh, and don't forget to try the Turkish wine.  This is a really lovely and fun place. We'll definitely be back.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Tuba is for me the best combination of Mediterranean (greek-turkish...) food in a sophisticated ambience I have visited so far (without including the luxurious Persian restaurants). It just opened this year on Guerrero and 22nd, in San Francisco, and I was very happy with the discovery. I had the tomato, onion and cucumber salad, a big platter full of fresh red delicious ripe vine tomato with the perfect Mediterranean seasoning of oil and vinegar, and leaves of mint very well cut so the aroma and flavour is not too intrusive. My entree was the eggplant puree with lamb and tomato sauce. It was light, perfect amount of food and very nice combination of flavours, although next time I will order the lamb ribs, which I saw them being served to another customer and they looked just as if I was back home in Spain: small. juicy surrounded by that small and golden perfect line of lamb fat. I asked the owner why the lamb didn't have that strong aftertaste usual to find when eating lamb and he told me that the lamb he uses is local fresh lamb meat, not the usual imported frozen and cheaper lamb used in many restaurants.The specialty dessert was good (kenafi, I think), although it is so sweet that you should better make some room for it (for intance by eating less warm bread, which in the other hand is great, with cummin).My only concern was the hummus. It was good but I missed some thickness and taste. I have realize that lately some restaurants offer a variation of hummus that is lighter, maybe to avoid the garbanzo and garlic flavour to be too intrusive, but I miss the usual texture and taste. I would definetely recommend the place for a nice dinner for couples or a small group of friends. If you make a reservation, ask for one of the two window tables, they are a very cozy corner.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: This place would've never landed on my radar but for the coupon I had bought. Tuba is a small and cozy Turkish place that seems to take pride in their food taking care to present the food well, and more important, the food was good quality. Boyfriend ordered a kebab (sirloin+lamb mix) and it was fab. At the waitress' suggestion, I ordered a manti (sp?) which is a turkish ravioli essentially. The other time I had manti before, it was disappointing and after hearing our waitress rave about it, I thought I'd give it another try. Sorry but I still don't love it. Nonetheless, it was seasoned well and well-made. Just not my thing. Service is five-stars. All the servers were very attentive.

SentimentText: First, I'll give credit where credit is due. I love the dolmas-- they have a unique texture and flavor with delicious spices. The stuffed eggplant is really good, and the salmon is pretty top-notch (they manage to get the skin perfectly crispy--not easy!) The atmosphere is also inviting, with nice low lighting and cool art on the walls.But honestly, I've been there twice now and have to say the service was truly sub-par. The first time I tried Tuba, it had just opened up and I guess they weren't getting much business yet. My girlfriend and I were one of two parties in the place, and the waiter was practically breathing down our necks the entire meal. When he wasn't checking in on us every five minutes, the entire waitstaff was just standing around the back of the restaurant staring at us. Um...awkward. Not to mention how every time someone stopped to look at the menu in the window, the manager would literally SPRINT across the restaurant, run outside, and beg them to come inside. One time I think he went an entire block to chase someone down. Hey Tuba? Desperation is not appetizing.Then at the end of the meal, I decided to order a cup of coffee (my girlfriend had the Turkish coffee which she said tasted like dirt, but maybe that's just her taste). So when the waiter brings the cup, I add cream, stir it up, and get ready to enjoy a nice coffee...until I take a sip and...it's definitely a strange tasting coffee. And by that I mean it wasn't coffee. It was tea. Yeahhhh tea. Majorly disappointing.The second time I went to Tuba they at least got the order right, but they can't seem to get the timing down. The appetizer came fast enough, but then there was a weirdly long wait before the entree. The waitress was kind of chilly, too, like she was mad at us or wanted to kill us, or something.So, although the food is definitely tasty, it's not out of this world-- and when you combine that with crappy service I'm just not thrilled with Tuba.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: In preparation for my upcoming trip to Turkey, I ventured out to this well recommended restaurant for a taste of Turkish delight.  To my delight, I found a great neighborhood gem that I will certainly revisit.  My meal started with a delcious lentil soup and for my main course I had their cold appetizer sampler platter.  This was not much different than other middle eastern samplers but each dip and salad had a special flare.  The one item that stood out most was surprisingly the humus.  It was silky, not grainy at all, flavorful without having a garlicky aftertaste.  Delicious!  The staff was friendly and helpful with our food selection. The owner/chef stopped by to greet us and ask about our dining experience. This place is a great find!
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Opening night, the place was a hit.The Boy and I had appetizers, entrees and dessert there tonight, and had absolutely nothing bad to say.Seriously.Nothing.First, the bread. Amazing, fresh out of the oven, studded with... something tasty, kinda salty... anyway, perfect. And some sort of peppered, cilantro'd butter made out of heaven and happiness. We kind of ate too much of it, honestly, especially once our waiter, Michael, brought out some sort of yoghurty dip and some spicy red stuff.We started with crab cakes for me and lentil soup for him. The crab cakes had this awesome consistency, soft and moist with a crunchy crust, and a bonus surprise of toasted pine nuts! What a perfect addition! It came with a salad that had this perfectly tangy dressing with just a hint of spice. Killer. I had trouble sharing. Boy's lentil soup was delicious, flavorful without being too salty, and again, with a hint of tang. Mediterranean. That's the thing. Right? Anyway, delicious.That reminds me. Never, during the course of our meal, did we reach for the salt or pepper. Everything was perfectly seasoned. Entrees. Yes. I had the lamb chops, Boy had the Salmon. Amazing. The salmon was perfectly tender, seasoned but not overly so. It was a great piece of fish, and you could taste it. The seasoning, and the slight bitterness in the rice (bay?) complemented, instead of covering, the taste. The lamb was perfectly cooked, with herbs that combined to make some sort of magical aura around the lamb, but I couldn't identify if you paid me a million dollars, on a bed of the same rice as the salmon, with some awesome kindofmaybe pickled carrots, zucchini and maybe cucumber? Anyway, awesome, and perfect consistency, a slight crunch, but not too much. Dessert! Boy had this incredible pyramid of panna cotta. Something like chocolate, then regular, then dark chocolate? It was some sort of creamy custardy chocolatey thing, then the most perfect panna cotta ever invented. Seriously. The whole thing was shaped into a pyramid, then covered in dark chocolate the Incas and Egyptians would be jealous of, mottled with white chocolate in cute little stripes, then surrounded in (mango? apricot? mangicot?) syrupy-puree stuff that had me literally licking his plate. When he wasn't looking. Because he's embarrassed by me sometimes. I had the house specialty, a (guys, I loved it so much I copied from the menu and emailed it to my mother with a picture) "Kunefe: Two layers of kadayif (shredded fillo dough) filled with sweet cheese, baked to perfection, and served with homemade syrup and pistachio nuts" Salty-sweet, warm in the middle with a cool syrup, crunchy and delicious, I can see why it was the house special. I can't wait to go back and try the other one I couldn't pronounce. Both of us had Turkish Coffee with dessert, which explains why I'm in Shotwell's Bar at 11:50 pm buzzing and drinking red wine and writing this review. OMGWHOAGUYSAnyway, highly recommended, a great asset to that block, which already has some excellent businesses (Tao is amazing, people. Why you don't eat there is a mystery to me, but do me a favor and don't take our table if you all of a sudden discover the place. Also, Que Tal is an awesome place to waste a morning, or work, whatever, and Liberties is a gem.) and hopefully won't fall prey to the same curse that has killed many a restaurant in that space. Also, apparently they need a tuba. Anyone got one they're getting rid of?
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: We had a wonderful meal here last night without breaking the bank. I had never heard of this place, but after combing yelp for something that seemed interesting but not too expensive, we think we scored. When we arrived, we felt like we were being welcomed into someone's home. The manager (owner?), greeted us like long lost friends. Service from start to finish was efficient and very personable and seemed to be quick without making us feel rushed. We got to sample a few by-the-glass wines before making our decision. They brought out warm flat bread with olives, feta and humus. Very yummy. We had the crab cake appetizer which was delicious. Very crabby (in a good way) and nice crisp crust on the outside (made with bulgar, I think). My entree was the beef manti. Loved the dainty little pockets and the sauce was just great. Hubby had the chicken shishkabobs which can be the epitome of sameness. This was just great. The meat was tender and flavorful. Loved the grilled veggies with it. The sole reason we picked this restaurant was to satisfy my craving for kunafe. I've had kunafe at a few other spots in the city, but this one was my favorite so far. Washed down with turkish coffee, we left stuffed and happy. As we left, we were escorted out by the manager. Really, we felt like we were regulars and if we lived closer, we probably would be. Servings were generous. With appetizers, wine, entrees and dessert for under $90! That's pretty good for San Francisco. I really can't wait to go back.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: This place is fantastic, and really underrated. It doesn't look all that from the outside, but once you get inside it is gorgeous - lots of wood, bright cushions and fabrics, interesting modern artwork and colored glassware. It feels a bit like stepping into a very stylish pasha's tent.The service is fantastic, really friendly and helpful but unobtrusive, and very kind to single diners coming in by themselves to enjoy a delicious meal over a book (there have always been several of these in there whenever I go - and it is great to find a restaurant that treats us solo diners well).The food - wow! Very authentic, varied and tasty. The dips, cold meze and vegetables sides are all great (especially the zucchini fritters) but the starring role has to be the meat, which is what I am usually craving when I end up here.Succulent, perfectly spiced kebabs, lamb chops and kofte grilled over a high heat to get that lovely crust on the outside, but remain tender and delicious. These guys are artists at this. The mixed grill is the best showcase for their skill - enough to share (or take half home if you are dining alone) and with a fantastic side of herbed, sauteed (I think?) carrot and zucchini and thinly sliced pickled red onion.Excellent wine list too - some unusual middle-eastern wines and a good selection of cheaper/more familiar Californian and South American options, with a good range of by-the-glass prices.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: I went to Tuba last week with my mom who was in from LA and the food was simply delicious.  Started out with the crispy feta cheese appetizer (perfect for sharing) and then had the Kofte Kebab for dinner - mom had lamb chops.  It was served with rice and veggies so the entire plate was quite substantial.  And even though we were full, we still had this delicious dessert who's name escapes me...The service was very good - friendly, attentive, helpful.  And since we didn't have drinks, the whole bill came to $45 which I thought was a bargain.  Can't wait to go back!!

SentimentText: A lot like its musical namesake, the food at Tuba was fun to try, but  needs some accompaniment. By my count there have been about 4 restaurants in this same spot over the past 5 years, and I would put Tuba somewhere in the middle of that group.  The feta shrimp we started out with were OK...they tasted as if they had been shelled before cooking, rather than after, which tends to drain the flavor.  My main course was beyti:  ground lamb and beef with spices, yogurt and tomato sauce.  It was fine, but a little bland.  The tomato sauce honestly tasted like it had just been poured from a can, and had zero pizazz.  The chicken kebab was also just fine, but was a little dry and lacking it spice.  The service was friendly.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: I really think this is by far the best Turkish Restaurant in the bay area. I am Turkish and I tried Sultana, Alaturka, Med Gill, etc. This place is by far better than any other place I tried. Adana Kebap is almost the same as the real deal in Turkey. Dolmas are home made. Kunefe is absolutely delicious. Last night I ate there, the bathroom did not have soap. I hope they address that issue. But it was spotless clean which is also welcome change as compared to some other Turkish restaurants. Decor also is very inviting. Parking is easy and you can bring your drink which makes the whole deal a lot cheaper.

SentimentText: Delicious Turkish food; reasonable prices; casual, comfy atmosphere; big portions; nice, attentive service. Need I say more? OK, I will. 6 of us for dinner last night and everyone enjoyed their meal. We ordered 3 hot appetizers with extra portions for all 6, 1 cold appetizer combo plate, 6 separate entrees and 3 desserts. Final cost was $33/each including tip. We all ate very well and the food was nicely prepared and tasty. Staff was friendly, attentive and helpful, but not smothering and hovering. I will definitely go back.

SentimentText: Have been here a couple of times. The first time, a couple of weeks after they opened, we went early on a weeknight, so it was not crowded & was very quiet. The owner spent a lot of time talking to us & recommending food. Very relaxed experience & the food was terrific. We had the cold appetizer platter, the cheese-stuffed falafel salad, the moussaka, & the kunefe for desert.Our second visit was the opposite experience. We had reservations for a group early on a Friday night. It turned out to be their first day back in business after closing for almost a week for kitchen renovations. The food & service were still good, but there were major problems in the kitchen. It took forever to get our food & two of our party did not get their entrees until long after the desert menus arrived. However, our waiter was very apologetic & helpful explaining about the kitchen problems & comping some of our food. Not the greatest dining experience--but definitely a memorable one.Even after the stress of our second visit, I'm still looking forward to going back to Tuba.  The food is so good and in the end, that's the most important thing.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Tuba serves very good Turkish cuisine at reasonable prices in a comfortable atmosphere.  It is a great neighborhood place for a casual meal.  The food is fresh and tasty and largely authentically Turkish with a few diversions into Italy and Greece.  I would particularly recommend the seasoned lamb served with an eggplant puree -- it is tasty, satisfying and quite different from typical "Mediterranean" offerings. The services is friendly and good.  The lack of a liquor license (for the moment) is a bit of downside but you can bring your own.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: I guess I like Turkish food, since I've liked all the Turkish restaurants I've attended.  At Tuba, the bread and seasoned butter (with garlic, herbs, and peppers, perhaps?) were one of the highlights; impulse control kept me from eating the whole basket.  The tomato, cuke, and onion salad was well-seasoned, but the tomatoes lacked flavor.The lamb kebab was tasty.  The amount of meat was modest - perhaps 3 or 4 oz. total - but I was grateful because then I felt free to indulge in dessert.  The kunefe dessert was like a grilled cheese sandwich soaked in syrup, which is a good thing in my book.  I'm glad I shared it, though - it's too rich to eat alone.Good service.

SentimentText: My husband is Turkish so we have been to all the Turkish restaurants in SF.  This one is definitely the best all-around in terms of atmosphere, service, and food.  The appetizers were top-notch and the entree that I had was delicious.For Bette's information, the bread they serve is Pide, which is the typical Turkish bread served with appetizers (meze).  And the tea served in the "shot glasses" is the way it is always served.  You should get out more.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: I really liked Tuba.  Not only is it a welcome addition to the 22nd St corridor, but the food is yummy and the portions represent a great value.  The service was great, attentive, but not intrusive and the design was warm and inviting/relaxing.  The recommended appetizers were perfect and my lamb kebab was cooked perfectly med rare and served with roasted veggies and rice.  A couple of dings:  No beer/wine license yet, but that won't take much longer.  The dessert of oven-baked rice pudding arrived cold (as in refrigerated).  Would have been a winner if served warm.  Lastly, and oddly, there was an auto air freshener somewhere close by our table that put out this rather strong citrus smell that detracted from our very yummy smelling dinner.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: A cozy spot in the Mission, food was average at a decent value, nothing to write home about.  The place was busy on a Saturday evening, but, fortunately, we had a reservation for our party of 5.  Service was good and our waitress was patient even though we dawdled over the menu and asked for a minute and another minute and yet another couple minutes to decide on our order.  The table shared the sigara boregi and Tuba cold platter which was pretty standard mediterranean fare.  The dill yogurt was quite good, the best of the sampler platter.  I was disappointed by the kufte kebab which was still too pink on the inside to eat without being on E. coli watch for the next 24-48 hours.  BF's adana kebab, on the other hand, was a little dry and overcooked.  Not sure how the other entrees fared, but I didn't hear any oohs and ahhs from the rest of our table.  We had good company and our meal didn't break the bank, but....NEXT!
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: I'm a Turk who has lived in the Bay Area for more than 15 years. I have been to just about all the Turkish restaurants that ever opened up.  Up until now, when my friends asked me to recommend a Turkish restaurant, I was always hesitant since I've never been too impressed with any of the offerings in the area.  However with the arrival of Tuba, I can safely recommend this to everyone I know - it is by far the best Turkish restaurant I've been to in the past 15 years, and I highly recommend it. Their cold & hot appetizers are especially good - mucver, mercimek koftesi, icli kofte, sigara boregi and ezme were delicious. You should also try the hot, sweet, cheese dessert called kunefe - you won't be disappointed!!!! The first time I was there was on Friday and the place was packed for the entire 2-3 hours we were there (reservations recommended).
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Though I've tried Mediterranean cuisine, this was my first foray into Turkish food...and it was delicious. I've already been lured to Tuba twice since it's grand opening this month.  The atmosphere is intimate and cozy; a perfect place to escape the winter rains.  The staff was informative, attentive and gracious.  All the dishes were very tasty--well seasoned, the meat perfectly cooked.  My absolute favorite entree was the Hunkar Begendi (pureed eggplant with lamb).  I also can't get enough of the kunefe, a cheese-filled pastry.  I've already started researching recipes, but I can only dream of recreating Tuba's version of this perfectly sweet dessert!
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: My son, his finance and I had dinner at Tuba last week. The food is fabulous, perfectly prepared, generous portions. We shared their country salad and it was more than enough for the three of us. I ordered the mixed shishkababs. The lamb was heavenly...could cut it with a fork! The seasoning was very authentic as well. The rice was perfectly prepared. Two dinners was sufficient for the three of us. The service was excellent, efficient and pleasant. The waiter was knowledge about all the dishes we ordered and answered all of our questions to our satisfaction. I will go back again and again. Thank you TUBA for being in my neighborhood.

SentimentText: Very happy Tuba has opened in our neighborhood!  We had a lovely dinner here tonight. Started with boregi, dolma, kofte w/bulgar, and white bean salad. All were delicious.  For our entree we had the Mixed Grill II. Enough meat for 4 people!  At least we have leftovers.  Dessert was rice pudding and Kanafeh. The rice pudding was mediocre. I think it would have been better without the mango tasting stuff that was on top. Just serve it like they do in Turkey!  The timing was off a bit but our waiter acknowledged this and the manager more than made up for any down time by stopping by to chat.  We did have to run home to grab a bottle of wine (no biggie since we live a block away) but I think they should note this on Open Table or on their website (which is still down?)  All in all, we look forward to going back soon!

SentimentText: Tuba has the potential to be great.  The service was good, although they had a huge party to tend to so the waitstaff was not as attentive as I'd have hoped.  However, the owner kept checking in with us to make sure everything was alright, and that was nice.  We ordered the crispy falafel, the beyti and the mixed grill.  The crispy falafel was good but slightly on the salty side.  The beyti was pretty good although the sirloin was a little on the dry side.  And the mixed grill was well...mixed.  We asked for the meat to be cooked medium.  The lamb was fantastic.  It was cooked perfectly.  However, the chicken and the kebab were overcooked.  The chicken was dry and the kebab was even dryer--to the point where it crumbled in your mouth and you had to drink something to get it down.  If not for the dryness, this dish would have been very good.  The meats were all spiced perfectly.I would definitely go back as I'm sure they are still working out some of the kinks.
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: Even though we didn't get bread during dinner, I'm still giving this place 5 stars because I'd love to go back.  I went to Tuba with 6 other people and everyone enjoyed the food.  For starters, we ordered the typical dolmas and falafels, which were pretty good.  As for entrees, we all kind of sampled each other's dish.  There were absolutely no complaints!  Some of the dishes ordered were: Adana kebab (3 people got this and they all loved it), Musakka (reminded me of a lasagna except with no pasta), and a dumpling dish stuffed with beef (or maybe it was lamb).  Even though the dumplings were good, I would recommend ordering an entree that comes with rice.  I don't know how they make their rice, but it is REALLY good.  For dessert, we shared the Kunefe and Pyramid Noisette Chocolate.  Both DELICIOUS!  Our waitress was also very attentive (although the restaurant wasn't extremely busy on the Sunday night that we went).  Bottom line: If you're looking for a new restaurant to try in the Mission, I'd definitely recommend going here!
Label: Genuine

SentimentText: We made a reservation yesterday (Friday) for Saturday). We get there early, and they tell us we have to wait.Alright, that's understandable. It's finally our reservation time and they tell us we have to wait even longer (15mins) because every table is full. What the hell is the point of making reservations at a certain time if you're not going to honor it?Keep in mind, this restaurant is small as hell, so you have to wait outside in the cold.The food was certainly not worth the wait.Mediocre at best. Not even kidding.I could have ordered a burger from McDonald's and been happy that.Yeah, you read that correctly, from McDonald's.Oh, and the rice haha, terrible.Your rice tastes like hospital/Minute White Rice.I'm not even joking.I definitely would not recommend eating here.You're better off grilling your own food and buying Minute White Rice from your local grocery.At least you'll save time and money.I NEVER post yelp reviews, but I really needed to post this after having a horrible experience.

SentimentText: I wish I could give this place 0 stars.  Have been here previously with friends food was good service was ok. Last time I made a reservation and went with my 6 year old son and my husband the restaurant was halfway full and was sat by the bathroom, we didn't think much of it. Today I made a reservation for 5:30 and again went with my son and husband. We walked in and there was 2 people in the whole entire restaurant, the rude host that walked us to our table wanted to sit us on a 3 top with one of the chairs facing the wall right next to the bathroom door, when my husband asked if we could sit at another table (since we would not be able to see our son) the host rudely responded stating that was all he had, at this point my husband was irate and told him the restaurant was empty, so the host offered to sit us all the way in the back of the restaurant towards the kitchen/bathrooms where we were sat previous time we came in, to top it off he had the nerves to say that he could not sit us anywhere else since he had reservations (mind you, I had reservations, and was ON TIME to my reservation). We left the restaurant pretty upset, on our drive to a different restaurant we received a phone call from Tuba, it was the same host that Rudely tried sitting us in the corner because of my son, instead of apologizing for the situation he was asking if we were planning on showing up to our 5:30 reservation!!! When my husband flipped out, the host realized who we were and decided to say it was all a misunderstanding. DO NOT go here if you have kids and want to be treated the way we were treated today!!! It was straight discrimination against kids!!! VERY unprofessional!!! Never going back and will not stop spreading the word!

SentimentText: I wish I could give this place 0 stars.  Have been here previously with friends food was good service was ok. Last time I made a reservation and went with my 6 year old son and my husband the restaurant was halfway full and was sat by the bathroom, we didn't think much of it. Today I made a reservation for 5:30 and again went with my son and husband. We walked in and there was 2 people in the whole entire restaurant, the rude host that walked us to our table wanted to sit us on a 3 top with one of the chairs facing the wall right next to the bathroom door, when my husband asked if we could sit at another table (since we would not be able to see our son) the host rudely responded stating that was all he had, at this point my husband was irate and told him the restaurant was empty, so the host offered to sit us all the way in the back of the restaurant towards the kitchen/bathrooms where we were sat previous time we came in, to top it off he had the nerves to say that he could not sit us anywhere else since he had reservations (mind you, I had reservations, and was ON TIME to my reservation). We left the restaurant pretty upset, on our drive to a different restaurant we received a phone call from Tuba, it was the same host that Rudely tried sitting us in the corner because of my son, instead of apologizing for the situation he was asking if we were planning on showing up to our 5:30 reservation!!! When my husband flipped out, the host realized who we were and decided to say it was all a misunderstanding. DO NOT go here if you have kids and want to be treated the way we were treated today!!! It was straight discrimination against kids!!! VERY unprofessional!!! Never going back and will not stop spreading the word!
Label: FAKE

SentimentText: My gosh!!! What a pitty ...I dont know how long its going to survive ....My advice is to the new owners would be please use some good produce and meat.

What a disappointment,,, Tuba had some decent food when it was opened first .I haven't seen the old business owner for a while .Im from Iran and i love Turkish food .The quality of cooking and ingredents has changed and so the  service.I knew this place has changed ownership .I know what is good turkish food.I went there more than 6 or 7 times .Last time i was there on friday Two weeks ago with my girlfriend.She had the adana and i had the chicken kebab .It was dry and no taste .No spices either .I have had better ADANA kebab in Turkey and when Tuba first opened .I wont be going back. What a pitty ...I dont know how long its going to survive ....My advice is to the new owners would be please use some good produce and meat.

SentimentText: We made a reservation yesterday (Friday) for Saturday). We get there early, and they tell us we have to wait.Alright, that's understandable. It's finally our reservation time and they tell us we have to wait even longer (15mins) because every table is full. What the hell is the point of making reservations at a certain time if you're not going to honor it?Keep in mind, this restaurant is small as hell, so you have to wait outside in the cold.The food was certainly not worth the wait.Mediocre at best. Not even kidding.I could have ordered a burger from McDonald's and been happy that.Yeah, you read that correctly, from McDonald's.Oh, and the rice haha, terrible.Your rice tastes like hospital/Minute White Rice.I'm not even joking.I definitely would not recommend eating here.You're better off grilling your own food and buying Minute White Rice from your local grocery.At least you'll save time and money.I NEVER post yelp reviews, but I really needed to post this after having a horrible experience.

SentimentText: I wish I could give this place 0 stars.  Have been here previously with friends food was good service was ok. Last time I made a reservation and went with my 6 year old son and my husband the restaurant was halfway full and was sat by the bathroom, we didn't think much of it. Today I made a reservation for 5:30 and again went with my son and husband. We walked in and there was 2 people in the whole entire restaurant, the rude host that walked us to our table wanted to sit us on a 3 top with one of the chairs facing the wall right next to the bathroom door, when my husband asked if we could sit at another table (since we would not be able to see our son) the host rudely responded stating that was all he had, at this point my husband was irate and told him the restaurant was empty, so the host offered to sit us all the way in the back of the restaurant towards the kitchen/bathrooms where we were sat previous time we came in, to top it off he had the nerves to say that he could not sit us anywhere else since he had reservations (mind you, I had reservations, and was ON TIME to my reservation). We left the restaurant pretty upset, on our drive to a different restaurant we received a phone call from Tuba, it was the same host that Rudely tried sitting us in the corner because of my son, instead of apologizing for the situation he was asking if we were planning on showing up to our 5:30 reservation!!! When my husband flipped out, the host realized who we were and decided to say it was all a misunderstanding. DO NOT go here if you have kids and want to be treated the way we were treated today!!! It was straight discrimination against kids!!! VERY unprofessional!!! Never going back and will not stop spreading the word!
Label: FAKE

SentimentText: I wish I could give this place 0 stars.  Have been here previously with friends food was good service was ok. Last time I made a reservation and went with my 6 year old son and my husband the restaurant was halfway full and was sat by the bathroom, we didn't think much of it. Today I made a reservation for 5:30 and again went with my son and husband. We walked in and there was 2 people in the whole entire restaurant, the rude host that walked us to our table wanted to sit us on a 3 top with one of the chairs facing the wall right next to the bathroom door, when my husband asked if we could sit at another table (since we would not be able to see our son) the host rudely responded stating that was all he had, at this point my husband was irate and told him the restaurant was empty, so the host offered to sit us all the way in the back of the restaurant towards the kitchen/bathrooms where we were sat previous time we came in, to top it off he had the nerves to say that he could not sit us anywhere else since he had reservations (mind you, I had reservations, and was ON TIME to my reservation). We left the restaurant pretty upset, on our drive to a different restaurant we received a phone call from Tuba, it was the same host that Rudely tried sitting us in the corner because of my son, instead of apologizing for the situation he was asking if we were planning on showing up to our 5:30 reservation!!! When my husband flipped out, the host realized who we were and decided to say it was all a misunderstanding. DO NOT go here if you have kids and want to be treated the way we were treated today!!! It was straight discrimination against kids!!! VERY unprofessional!!! Never going back and will not stop spreading the word!
Label: FAKE

What a pitty ...I dont know how long its going to survive ....My advice is to the new owners would be please use some good produce and meat.

SentimentText: We made a reservation yesterday (Friday) for Saturday). We get there early, and they tell us we have to wait.Alright, that's understandable. It's finally our reservation time and they tell us we have to wait even longer (15mins) because every table is full. What the hell is the point of making reservations at a certain time if you're not going to honor it?Keep in mind, this restaurant is small as hell, so you have to wait outside in the cold.The food was certainly not worth the wait.Mediocre at best. Not even kidding.I could have ordered a burger from McDonald's and been happy that.Yeah, you read that correctly, from McDonald's.Oh, and the rice haha, terrible.Your rice tastes like hospital/Minute White Rice.I'm not even joking.I definitely would not recommend eating here.You're better off grilling your own food and buying Minute White Rice from your local grocery.At least you'll save time and money.I NEVER post yelp reviews, but I really needed to post this after having a horrible experience.

SentimentText: We made a reservation yesterday (Friday) for Saturday). We get there early, and they tell us we have to wait.Alright, that's understandable. It's finally our reservation time and they tell us we have to wait even longer (15mins) because every table is full. What the hell is the point of making reservations at a certain time if you're not going to honor it?Keep in mind, this restaurant is small as hell, so you have to wait outside in the cold.The food was certainly not worth the wait.Mediocre at best. Not even kidding.I could have ordered a burger from McDonald's and been happy that.Yeah, you read that correctly, from McDonald's.Oh, and the rice haha, terrible.Your rice tastes like hospital/Minute White Rice.I'm not even joking.I definitely would not recommend eating here.You're better off grilling your own food and buying Minute White Rice from your local grocery.At least you'll save time and money.I NEVER post yelp reviews, but I really needed to post this after having a horrible experience.
Label: FAKE

SentimentText: I wish I could give this place 0 stars.  Have been here previously with friends food was good service was ok. Last time I made a reservation and went with my 6 year old son and my husband the restaurant was halfway full and was sat by the bathroom, we didn't think much of it. Today I made a reservation for 5:30 and again went with my son and husband. We walked in and there was 2 people in the whole entire restaurant, the rude host that walked us to our table wanted to sit us on a 3 top with one of the chairs facing the wall right next to the bathroom door, when my husband asked if we could sit at another table (since we would not be able to see our son) the host rudely responded stating that was all he had, at this point my husband was irate and told him the restaurant was empty, so the host offered to sit us all the way in the back of the restaurant towards the kitchen/bathrooms where we were sat previous time we came in, to top it off he had the nerves to say that he could not sit us anywhere else since he had reservations (mind you, I had reservations, and was ON TIME to my reservation). We left the restaurant pretty upset, on our drive to a different restaurant we received a phone call from Tuba, it was the same host that Rudely tried sitting us in the corner because of my son, instead of apologizing for the situation he was asking if we were planning on showing up to our 5:30 reservation!!! When my husband flipped out, the host realized who we were and decided to say it was all a misunderstanding. DO NOT go here if you have kids and want to be treated the way we were treated today!!! It was straight discrimination against kids!!! VERY unprofessional!!! Never going back and will not stop spreading the word!
Label: FAKE

SentimentText: My gosh!!! What a disappointment,,, Tuba had some decent food when it was opened first .I haven't seen the old business owner for a while .Im from Iran and i love Turkish food .The quality of cooking and ingredents has changed and so the  service.I knew this place has changed ownership .I know what is good turkish food.I went there more than 6 or 7 times .Last time i was there on friday Two weeks ago with my girlfriend.She had the adana and i had the chicken kebab .It was dry and no taste .No spices either .I have had better ADANA kebab in Turkey and when Tuba first opened .I wont be going back. What a pitty ...I dont know how long its going to survive ....My advice is to the new owners would be please use some good produce and meat.
Label: FAKE
